Description: A terracotta standing monkey, probably an orator, wearing a hooded cloak, his left hand holding its front edge. The right arm is missing and was apparently finished that way, before firing: later a separately made arm would be applied with a plaster adhesive. The long V-shape of the cloak is shown on the back. The feet are damaged. Probably hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with a brown surface. There are traces of an overall white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in Cairo. Ptolemaic, first century BC. Comparanda: Close: Pons Mellado 1998: 117, no. 1981/1/225. Near: Breccia 1930: no. 472, from the Kom el-Shugafa cemetery at Alexandria.
